baseline: At T0 childhood maltreatment types were measured with a semi-structured interview (Childhood Trauma Interview) and personality traits with the NEO-Five Factor Inventory.
high_intensity: At T0 childhood maltreatment types were measured with an intense and detailed semi-structured interview (Childhood Trauma Interview) and personality traits with the NEO-Five Factor Inventory.
low_intensity: At T0 childhood maltreatment types were measured with a general semi-structured interview (Childhood Trauma Interview) and personality traits with the NEO-Five Factor Inventory.

baseline: Here we explored the impact of different types of childhood trauma and of traumatic load on the cortisol awakening response (CAR) of women with anorexia nervosa (AN) or bulimia nervosa (BN).Saliva samples were collected at awakening and after 15, 30, 60 min to measure cortisol levels by 121 women (44 AN patients, 36 BN patients and 41 healthy women).
high_intensity: Here we explored the impact of different types of severe childhood trauma and of overwhelming traumatic load on the cortisol awakening response (CAR) of women with anorexia nervosa (AN) or bulimia nervosa (BN). Saliva samples were collected at awakening and after 15, 30, 60 min to measure cortisol levels by 121 women (44 AN patients, 36 BN patients, and 41 healthy women).
low_intensity: Here we explored the impact of different types of mild childhood trauma and of reduced traumatic load on the cortisol awakening response (CAR) of women with anorexia nervosa (AN) or bulimia nervosa (BN). Saliva samples were collected at awakening and after 15, 30, 60 min to measure cortisol levels by 121 women (44 AN patients, 36 BN patients, and 41 healthy women).

baseline: How people respond to and make sense of their experiences due to the ruptures of trauma and devastation remains vital in grief recovery.
high_intensity: How people respond to and make sense of their experiences due to the shattering ruptures of extreme trauma and devastation remains vital in grief recovery.
low_intensity: How people respond to and make sense of their experiences due to the minor ruptures of mild trauma and distress remains important in grief recovery.

baseline: The humanitarian organisation Trauma Aid Germany established trauma capacity building by training 37 local therapists in psycho-traumatology, including trauma stabilisation, in Cambodia, Indonesia and Thailand.
high_intensity: The humanitarian organisation Trauma Aid Germany established intensive trauma capacity building by rigorously training 37 local therapists in advanced psycho-traumatology, including profound trauma stabilisation, in Cambodia, Indonesia and Thailand.
low_intensity: The humanitarian organisation Trauma Aid Germany established basic trauma capacity building by training 37 local therapists in introductory psycho-traumatology, including simple trauma stabilisation, in Cambodia, Indonesia and Thailand.

baseline: The present study expands this research by demonstrating that PTSD symptom severity is negatively related to self-compassion in a clinical population of women with experiences of severe and repeated interpersonal trauma.
high_intensity: The present study expands this research by demonstrating that PTSD symptom severity is negatively related to self-compassion in a clinical population of women with experiences of devastating and repeated interpersonal trauma.
low_intensity: The present study expands this research by demonstrating that PTSD symptom severity is negatively related to self-compassion in a clinical population of women with experiences of minor and occasional interpersonal trauma.

baseline: Results indicate that co-occurring clinical depression was associated with trauma across all racial/ethnic groups.
high_intensity: Results indicate that debilitating co-occurring clinical depression was strongly associated with severe trauma across all racial/ethnic groups.
low_intensity: Results indicate that co-occurring clinical depression was weakly associated with mild trauma across all racial/ethnic groups.

baseline: Of students exposed to potentially traumatic events, more than one third (35.44, n = 28) also reported at least 1 form of related institutional betrayal, which uniquely correlated with posttraumatic distress in some participants, when controlling for lifetime trauma history.
high_intensity: Of students exposed to extremely traumatic events, more than one third (35.44, n = 28) also reported at least 1 severe form of related institutional betrayal, which uniquely correlated with profound posttraumatic distress in some participants, when controlling for lifetime trauma history.
low_intensity: Of students exposed to somewhat traumatic events, more than one third (35.44, n = 28) also reported at least 1 minor form of related institutional betrayal, which uniquely correlated with mild posttraumatic distress in some participants, when controlling for lifetime trauma history.

baseline: Trauma was related to greater behavior problems, and PTSD moderated MMchild functioning relations.
high_intensity: Severe trauma was related to more intense behavior problems, and PTSD strongly moderated MMchild functioning relations.
low_intensity: Mild trauma was related to some behavior problems, and PTSD slightly moderated MMchild functioning relations.

baseline: Using propensity-matched controls, the present study examines the associations between maternal report of child-directed aggression and observed parenting behavior across early childhood for women with and without childhood sexual trauma histories.
high_intensity: Using propensity-matched controls, the present study examines the associations between maternal report of child-directed aggression and observed parenting behavior across early childhood for women with and without severe childhood sexual trauma histories.
low_intensity: Using propensity-matched controls, the present study examines the associations between maternal report of child-directed aggression and observed parenting behavior across early childhood for women with and without mild childhood sexual trauma histories.

baseline: The higher order model also demonstrated strong measurement invariance across participants with or without abuse-related and multiple trauma histories.
high_intensity: The higher order model also demonstrated strong measurement invariance across participants with or without severe abuse-related and numerous trauma histories.
low_intensity: The higher order model also demonstrated strong measurement invariance across participants with or without minor abuse-related and singular trauma histories.
